description: The temporary use and erection of temporary structures including vehicle access areas and fencing, for the purposes of hosting a London 2012 Training Venue at the Sobell Centre.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION:  The erection of the temporary structures hereby approved is granted only for a limited period, being until  30th August 2012, on or before that date the structures and all its associated/ancillary goods shall be dismantled and removed from the site and the land shall be reinstated to the condition as evident prior to the erection of the temporary structures hereby approved or another condition as agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

REASON:  The temporary structures are such that the Local Planning Authority is only prepared to grant permission for a limited period in view of the special circumstances of this case. The limitation of the consent period ensures compliance with policies: CS17 of the Islington Core Strategy and section 57(2) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended)
